diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Cholelithiasis, Acute renal failure, Esophageal reflux
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with RUQ/epigastric pain accompanied by nausea and vomiting. The ultrasound findings were consistent with cholecystitis, including gallstones and GB wall thickening. This presentation, along with her clinical history and surgical intervention (Laparoscopic cholecystectomy), supports the diagnosis of gallstone pancreatitis.
